About.default: A medical doctor (MD) is a highly trained healthcare professional who diagnoses, treats, and prevents illnesses and injuries. They use their expertise to assess patients' health through examinations, medical history, and diagnostic tests. MDs can specialize in various fields, such as internal medicine, pediatrics, surgery, or psychiatry. They develop treatment plans, prescribe medications, and may perform surgeries or other medical procedures. Medical doctors play a crucial role in improving patient health and managing complex medical conditions
